newsTopics.targetAudience: CEOs/MDs of European SMBs (50-500 employees), compliance leads at independent law firms, managing partners at pharma/biotech SMEs
newsTopics.note: August 2026 enforcement = Pedro's clearest commercial trigger. SMBs are underserved vs. big corps.

newsTopics.targetAudience: Managing partners and senior associates at independent/boutique law firms (5-50 lawyers). Anna's profile.
newsTopics.note: Law firms are compliance guardians with GDPR fears. Local-first AI = perfect pitch. Anna is the proof.

newsTopics.targetAudience: CEOs/CTOs of CROs, generic pharma companies, small biotech (under 500 employees). Pedro's Grupo Moja Farmacja background is a differentiator.
newsTopics.note: Pedro's pharma ops background = trust builder. AVOID: Pfizer, Roche, Novartis — they have it in-house.

newsTopics.targetAudience: COOs/Ops Directors at mid-market logistics, retail chains, manufacturing firms. The Skeptical Stabilizer persona.
newsTopics.note: Pedro's XL Energy / Glownet operations background resonates. Avoid logistics giants (DHL, Maersk).

newsTopics.targetAudience: Pedro's home markets. Polish and Portuguese SMBs are 6-12 months behind Western Europe in AI adoption = opportunity.
newsTopics.note: Geographic edge: Pedro speaks both languages, understands both markets.

newsTopics.targetAudience: Gen X executives who see AI headlines and feel lost — Pedro's 'Noise → Translation → Action' format.
newsTopics.note: Content angle: 'Here is what this week's AI news means for your business in plain language.'

noise.description: State the raw AI headline in 1-2 sentences. What happened. Just the facts — no opinion, no spin.
noise.tone: Neutral, factual, journalist-style. No adjectives like 'groundbreaking' or 'revolutionary'.

translation.description: What this actually means for a mid-market European business in plain language. Cut through the hype. What changes in practice for a 50-200 person company?
translation.tone: Direct, experienced, slightly wry. The 'adult in the room' who has seen ten waves of tech hype.

action.description: One concrete thing Pedro can help with, or one thing the reader should do or consider. Specific, not generic. First-person offer.
action.tone: Actionable, confident, practitioner voice. No buzzwords. Can be a direct offer ('I can help you do X in 2 weeks').

analogPerspective.description: Pedro's unique lens: 50yo Xennial entrepreneur with 25+ years in analog + digital operations. He bridges pre-digital institutional knowledge with AI execution. Regulated industries. EU context. No hype.
themes: The Xennial advantage — I started working before mobile phones. I understand org politics, change resistance, and why legacy processes exist.
EU AI Act countdown — August 2026 enforcement is real. SMBs are underserved and running out of time.
Governed execution over experimentation — AI projects fail when no adult is in the room.
Microsoft 365 first — most SMBs already pay for Copilot and don't use it. Start there before buying anything new.
Data sovereignty matters in Europe — don't send client data to US servers if you're in pharma, legal, or finance.
Local-first AI for regulated industries — on-premise and private cloud deployments for GDPR compliance.
Skeptic by default — if a vendor says their tool is risk-free or works out of the box, they're selling, not advising.
